job.title: Business Development Manager – IT Staffing Services (34025)
job.description:
Title: Business Development Manager – IT Staffing Services.

About us: Myticas Consulting Group of Companies. Myticas specializes in IT Staffing and Recruitment Services with over 50 years of combined experience in the IT Staffing industry. We serve clients in all industries in the United States and Canada with offices in Ottawa, Chicago, Atlanta, Cleveland, and Grand Rapids. 

About the position: The Sr. Business Development professional will sit in our Chicago, Illinois office This position is a hybrid role and requires some travel. This position is responsible for Business Development in this area as a priority, but able to develop business in OH, PA, WV, IN, IL, etc. This position comes with a competitive salary, commission, bonus potential, medical, dental, vision, 401K, and PTO. This professional would have full access to training, access to and support from the marketing department and technical tools in support of their success. 

Job Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Initiate contact, develop relationships, and conduct business development activities with clients and professionals; networking and connecting with IT professionals, executives, managers, and other professionals and resources at potential, new, and existing clients.
  • Research and qualify new clients, conducting business development activities and negotiating terms of service and agreements with new clients.
  • Provided expert level staffing support to clients, hiring managers, and professionals. Qualifying technical position requirements and coordinating with technical recruiters to fulfill staffing needs for new and existing clients.
  • Represent and market the  Myticas Consulting Group brands.
  • Participate, network at, support, and sponsor events involving the technical community.
  • Sell via telephone, face-to-face and videoconferencing.
  • Utilize Bullhorn CRM/Application tracking system for client and manager outreach and keep CRM documentation, agreements, resources, and paperwork up to date.

Required Experience:

  • 3-5 years’ demonstrated record of success selling staffing services, preferably with experience in the IT environment.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Outstanding customer service, integrity, and interpersonal skills.  
  • Energetic, enthusiastic, self-motivated, collaborative.
  • Passion for the staffing industry, excellent work ethic, and strong desire to succeed.

job.title: Business Architect / Consultant – Digital Commerce & Manufacturing (34297)
job.description:
We are seeking a highly experienced Business Architect/Consultant with a strong understanding of the Industrial Manufacturing sector. This role plays a key part in helping our clients recognize the value of their partnership with us—acting as a strategic advisor across B2B, B2C/DTC Commerce, PIM, Supply Chain, and Marketplace initiatives.

Role Overview
The Business Architect/Consultant works at the intersection of business strategy and digital commerce execution. You will guide clients through discovery, define future-state solutions, support implementation teams, and serve as a trusted thought partner who brings clarity, structure, and industry insight to complex challenges.

Key Responsibilities
Discovery & Engagement Leadership
  • Support the leadership of client engagements by driving discovery activities and shaping the strategic direction.
  • Conduct structured workshops (requirements gathering, current-state analysis, pain-point exploration, and future-state visioning) to extract detailed, actionable insights.
  • Convert business challenges into clearly articulated requirements, user stories, and process designs—surfacing gaps, dependencies, and risks across business and technology teams.
  • Produce high-quality discovery deliverables, including:
  • As-is and to-be process flows
  • Requirements documentation
  • User journeys, use cases, and activity diagrams
  • Integration and data considerations
  • Executive-ready summaries and recommendations
Strategic Advisory
  • Operate as a trusted advisor to senior client leaders by applying deep knowledge of Manufacturing and Digital Commerce ecosystems.
  • Provide guidance on strategic roadmaps, operating models, and modernization approaches.
  • Advise on digital commerce platform capabilities, solution components, and architectural considerations in partnership with technical architects.
  • Prepare concise decision-ready materials that help executives prioritize investments and understand business impact.
  • Assess digital commerce strategies or channels and recommend initiatives to drive measurable growth or efficiency.
Client Delivery & Implementation Support
  • Work closely with Engagement Managers/Directors to maintain scope, manage stakeholders, and ensure successful execution.
  • Ensure requirements are ready for implementation teams; validate estimates, assumptions, and solution approaches.
  • Collaborate with development and architecture teams to evaluate trade-offs between usability, performance, and technical feasibility.
  • Participate in or lead quarterly business reviews with clients to guide ongoing success and optimization.
Thought Leadership
  • Engage with industry analysts and stay current with trends in commerce, supply chain, and industrial manufacturing.
  • Create thought leadership content (articles, whitepapers, short videos/webinars) showcasing expertise in Manufacturing and Digital Commerce.
  • Represent The Company at conferences, webinars, and industry events as a subject-matter expert.

Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Marketing, Engineering, or a related field.
  • 5+ years of experience as a Business Analyst, Business Architect, Solution Architect, or similar role within eCommerce or digital transformation environments.
  • Strong familiarity with the Industrial Manufacturing domain is highly preferred.
  • Proven background in eCommerce consulting—including strategy development, financial/business modeling, and competitive analysis.
  • Demonstrated ability to lead complex initiatives and deliver solutions within scope, timelines, and budgets.
  • Excellent communication skills, including the ability to present to C-Suite audiences and distill complex information into clear priorities.

Preferred Skills
  • Business Analysis certification (e.g., CBAP, CCBA).
  • Experience working in a consulting or professional services environment.

job.title: FPGA / Hardware Design Engineer, Intermediate (3 Positions) (34281)
job.description:
FPGA / Hardware Design Engineer
 

We are seeking an FPGA/Hardware Engineer to help design and optimize advanced media transport and processing systems for high-performance video, audio, and data applications. This role involves hands-on design, testing, and support of production-grade solutions.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop FPGA-based solutions for video/audio transport and real-time processing (SMPTE ST 2110/IP, SDI).

  • Implement and optimize RTL designs, with a focus on 4K performance, data compression, and parallel processing.

  • Support hardware testing, debugging, and validation in lab environments.

  • Contribute to new product introduction (NPI) through design, documentation, and test activities.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams on requirements, component selection, and technical documentation.

What We’re Looking For

  • 2+ years of FPGA or hardware design experience (video/audio focus preferred).

  • Hands-on experience with Intel and/or Xilinx FPGA platforms and design tools.

  • Proficiency with SystemVerilog (preferred), VHDL, or HLS; scripting in TCL/SDC.

  • Familiarity with high-speed interfaces (Ethernet, DDR), transceivers, and timing analysis.

  • Strong problem-solving, debugging, and communication skills.

Nice to Have

  • Exposure to Linux-based development and programming in C/C++ or Python.

  • Knowledge of digital video/audio standards (SDI, AES, NMOS) and broadcast workflows.

  • Experience with packet processing, routing protocols, or PTP synchronization.

job.title: Guidewire Technical Lead (34235)
job.description:

Responsibilities

  • Implement workflows, rules, data models, and UI components (PCFs).

  • Participate in requirements gathering and solution design with client stakeholders.

  • Provide technical support and troubleshoot issues during implementation.

Qualifications

  • Proven experience designing and delivering solutions with Guidewire PolicyCenter, BillingCenter, and ClaimCenter.

  • Experience conducting code reviews and mentoring offshore development teams.

job.title: Senior Blockchain Solution Engineer (33946)
job.description:
Our Toronto area client in the Finance space, is looking for a Senior Blockchain Engineer to support the development of foundational digital asset capabilities, including custody solutions, integrations with internal systems, and vendor technology enablement. This role requires strong blockchain expertise paired with modern full-stack engineering skills.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design and build blockchain-based solutions covering custody, protocols, and digital asset workflows

  • Integrate blockchain services with internal enterprise systems and vendor platforms

  • Develop RESTful and/or GraphQL APIs

  • Build cloud-native, microservices-based applications

  • Participate in Agile teams (Scrum/Kanban) and contribute to full SDLC practices

  • Support infrastructure deployments using IaC tools (Terraform, Ansible)

  • Work with cross-functional business and technical stakeholders

Required Skills & Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree required

  • 3+ years of professional engineering experience

  • Hands-on experience with modern full-stack JavaScript (Node.js, React, Express)

  • Strong understanding of Ethereum, Quorum, and/or Solidity

  • Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, and container orchestration

  • API development experience (REST/GraphQL)

  • Experience deploying environments using Terraform/Ansible

  • Familiarity with enterprise systems (SaaS, ERP, SAP)

  • Strong communication skills

  • Willingness to travel within GTA as needed

Nice to Have:

  • Experience with digital asset ecosystems (stablecoins, custody services, wallets, blockchain protocols)

job.title: UX Designer (33633)
job.description:
• Leads discovery activities to understand users, define audience segments, and map end-to-end customer journeys that inform product strategy.

  • Conducts qualitative and quantitative research (interviews, usability sessions, behavioral studies) to surface user needs, pain points, and opportunity areas.

  • Translates research findings into actionable artifacts such as personas, journey maps, workflow diagrams, and experience recommendations.

  • Evaluates existing digital products—especially B2B applications—to identify UX gaps, workflow friction, and optimization opportunities.

  • Applies Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) principles to ensure intuitive interaction patterns and user-centred design decisions.

  • Leverages analytics and research tools (e.g., GA4, Hotjar, insight platforms) to validate assumptions, detect behavioral patterns, and support data-driven decisions.

  • Uses collaborative design tools (Figma, Miro, etc.) to prototype concepts, facilitate workshops, and guide cross-functional teams through ideation and solutioning.

  • Communicates research insights, concepts, and design rationale clearly to stakeholders to ensure shared alignment across discovery and delivery phases.

  • Partners with marketing/brand teams to incorporate visual identity and brand expression into user experiences.

  • Synthesizes complex data into clear experience frameworks, demonstrating creativity, strong organization, and attention to detail while staying current with UX industry practices.

job.title: Senior Database Administrator (33988)
job.description:
Our Ottawa based client in the Finance industry is looking for Senior SECRET security Cleared Database Administrator to support enterprise storage and database services across on-prem and Azure cloud environments. The Consultant will install, configure, maintain, secure, and optimize database platforms while providing operational support and resolving complex technical issues.

Key Responsibilities

  • Perform database performance tuning, analysis, and monitoring.

  • Implement and maintain backup/recovery strategies (RMAN, point-in-time recovery).

  • Execute database security administration and ensure authorized data access.

  • Maintain schema objects and support production migrations.

  • Ensure data consistency and adherence to data model standards.

  • Troubleshoot and resolve database technical issues, including complex escalations.

  • Support and collaborate with existing DBA teams.

  • Deliver additional related tasks as required.

Required Technical Experience (Minimum 5+ Years)

Recent hands-on experience with:

  • Azure SQL & Azure SQL Managed Instance (MI)

  • Oracle Exadata deployed in Azure environments

  • Oracle 19c and SQL Server 2019+

  • Cloud SQL PaaS services (Azure)

  • Oracle Exadata Database Service

  • PostgreSQL on Azure

  • Oracle Exadata, Data Guard, RAC

  • RMAN (backup, restore, PITR)

  • Data Pump (database/data migration)

  • Oracle TDE (Transparent Data Encryption)

Additional Considered Qualifications

  • Experience with Oracle Autonomous Database

  • Knowledge of Commvault

  • Knowledge of Dynatrace

  • Certifications such as:

    • Microsoft Certified: Azure Database Administrator Associate

    • Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator Associate

    • Oracle Cloud certifications

    • OCP or equivalent

Equipment & Access Requirem

job.title: ASIC Design Engineer (34011)
job.description:
We are seeking a highly experienced Senior ASIC Design Engineer to join a high-performance hardware development team. This role involves end-to-end ASIC design, from micro-architecture definition through implementation and debug, supporting advanced high-speed communication systems.

Key Responsibilities

  • Define micro-architecture and contribute to system-level ASIC design decisions

  • Implement and verify complex digital logic for high-performance ASICs

  • Debug functional, timing, and integration issues across the design lifecycle

  • Collaborate closely with architecture, verification, physical design, and system teams

  • Support design reviews, documentation, and design sign-off activities

  • Contribute to continuous improvement of design methodologies and tools

Required Skills and Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering; advanced degree preferred

  • Minimum of 10 years of hands-on ASIC design experience

  • Strong skills in micro-architecture, RTL design, and design debugging

  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical abilities

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills

  • Solid understanding of the full ASIC design flow and associated EDA tools

  • Ability to work effectively in a collaborative, multi-disciplinary environment

Preferred Qualifications / Assets

  • Experience with MATLAB and scripting languages (e.g., Python, Perl, Tcl)

  • Familiarity with telecom and high-speed interface protocols such as OTN, CAUI, or similar

  • Working knowledge of DSP, FEC, and digital communication theory

  • Design experience supporting Ethernet standards from 100G through 800G

job.title: Network Management System Developer (34086)
job.description:
Myticas is looking for a Senior NMS developer, who will be responsible for ensuring the seamless operation of our clients network by leading the design, implementation, and maintenance of the NMS of the system.
Main Responsibilities
  • Lead the design and analysis of NMS applications for managing network elements.
  • Drive vendor collaboration to evaluate and integrate NMS solutions aligned with industry standards and emerging technologies.
  • Oversee technical documentation to ensure architectural integrity and development quality.
  • Maintain comprehensive NMS documentation to support transparency, maintainability, and operational efficiency.
  • Develop YANG modules for modular resource, service, fault and performance management.
  • Lead resolution of complex implementation and network issues through cross-functional coordination and root cause analysis.
  • Design and maintain advanced automated test suites to support NMS validation and CI/CD practices.
  • Define security standards to ensure system integrity and policy compliance.
  • Contribute to system-level modeling, including interface definitions and CONOPS for Lightspeed.
  • Collaborate across engineering and operations teams to ensure seamless NMS integration.
  • Recommend and drive system-wide improvements to the architecture.
Education and Experience Required
  • Bachelor's in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
  • 12+ years of experience in a similar role.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of design principles, and specifications for standardized and interoperable NMS Systems.
  • Solid knowledge of EMS protocols and modelling languages such as: NETCONF/RESTCONF, gRPC/gNMI, gNOI, YANG, UML
  • Familiarity with TMForum Open Digital Architecture (ODA), Process Framework (eTOM), TMForum APIs, is a plus
  • Familiarity with Model-based systems engineering (MBSE) is an asset.
  • Knowledge of MEF Lifecycle Service Orchestration (MEF LSO APIs) framework is an asset

job.title: Senior Embedded Developer - Principal (32925)
job.description:
Principal Embedded Software Developer will play a pivotal role in driving the architectural and design aspects of our software projects.
They will collaborate closely with System Engineering and other cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration and alignment with our organizational objectives and be a technical lead within the Scrum Team, guiding and influencing the team's decisions to achieve optimal outcomes. In addition, they will lead technical discussions with our valued vendors and partners, fostering strong relationships and provide vital day-to-day guidance to team members, promoting a cohesive and productive work environment.
MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:
    • Lead the design, development, and implementation of advanced satellite ground segment software systems, ensuring high performance, scalability, and reliability.
    • Lead the design, development, and implementation of embedded application software, board support software and OS integration
    • Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to define architecture, technical specifications, and software requirements for ground segment systems.
    • Provide technical leadership, mentorship, and guidance to the engineering team, fostering a collaborative and innovative environment.
    • Architect software solutions that adhere to Test-Driven Development (TDD) principles and utilize simulated software to rigorously test code functionality.
    • Design software with a profound understanding of hardware resource limitations to ensure optimal performance in resource-constrained environments.
    • Stay current with the latest advancements in satellite technology and industry trends, driving innovation and maintaining technical excellence.
    • Implement and support MPLS/WAN/SD-WAN circuits and subnets.
    • Guide the team in troubleshooting and resolving complex technical issues, ensuring the stability and reliability of ground segment software.
    • Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into effective technical solutions.
    • Utilize expertise in cloud technology, virtualization, and containerization to optimize software deployment and management.
    • Leverage software modeling tools to create robust and efficient software architectures.
    • Foster a culture of continuous improvement, helping to evolve development processes, tools, and methodologies.
EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE REQUIRED
    • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
    • 10 + years of experience in software development, focusing on satellite communication systems.
Specialized Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
    • Knowledge of systems engineering fundamentals (networking, storage, operating systems)
    • Experience programming with at least one or more programming languages such as C++, Java, Python, Golang, PowerShell
    • Deep understanding of satellite technology, ground segment operations, and associated challenges.
    • Good understanding of networking and routing protocols 
    • Experience supporting and implementing MPLS/WAN/SD-WAN circuits and subnets.
    • Prior experience in a technical leadership or architecture role.
    • Strong problem-solving skills, capable of addressing intricate technical challenges.
    • Excellent communication skills to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
    • Familiarity with Test-Driven Development (TDD) and simulated software testing methodologies.
    • Ability to design software with consideration for hardware resource constraints.
    • Experience with cloud technology, virtualization, and containerization.
    • Proficiency in using software modeling tools to create robust architectures.
    • Familiarity with Agile development methodologies.
    • Experience working with geographically dispersed teams.

job.title: End Point Security Engineer (34499)
job.description:
Myticas's direct client, based in Lemont, IL is currently seeking a Endpoint Security Engineer for a 100% Remote contract position.

NOTE:  Must be a US Citizen.
 
Work Schedule: Work schedule is normal business hours 8:30am – 5:00pm CST, Monday through Friday. Work outside of these hours is not required or anticipated. Contract should be for one year (2080 hours), extended as needed.

TOP Required Skills/Experience:

1. Endpoint Management Platform Expertise
Hands-on experience with SCCM (System Center Configuration Manager), Jamf Pro, and/or Microsoft Intune for managing and securing Windows and macOS endpoints in an enterprise environment.

2. Vulnerability Management & Analysis
Proven ability to identify, analyze, and remediate endpoint vulnerabilities using tools like Tenable, Axonius, and native platform tools (Jamf, SCCM, Intune), with knowledge of frameworks such as NIST 800-53 and CIS Benchmarks.
3. Scripting & Automation Proficiency
Strong scripting skills in PowerShell, Bash, and/or Python, with experience developing modular, reusable, and secure automation for endpoint remediation and configuration management.
4. Secure SDLC & Documentation Practices
Experience with secure software development lifecycle (SDLC) practices, version control (Git), and creating clear documentation for scripts, configurations, and remediation procedures to ensure maintainability and cross-team adoption.
5. Security Framework & Compliance Knowledge
Understanding of NIST 800-53 Rev 5, CIS Benchmarks, DISA STIGs, and Microsoft Security Baselines, with the ability to implement and monitor secure baseline configurations aligned with organizational and regulatory standards.

Job Description: 
BIS-EE is seeking a full-time Endpoint Security Engineer to assist in improving our endpoint cyber hygiene and vulnerability management program in collaboration with the CSPO.

2 Scope:

This engagement requires a contract for a position for 1 year at 40 hours per week. The Endpoint Security Engineer will work closely with BIS-EE and CSPO.

3 Objectives:

The ideal candidate will work with and support the projects and tasks associated with endpoint security and endpoint vulnerability management.

4 Tasks and Delivery (Job Responsibilities):

The Endpoint Security Engineer (contractor) will be embedded within the endpoint engineering team (3 Windows engineers, 2 macOS engineers) to enhance security operations and strengthen the security posture of client workstations. Typical responsibilities include:

5 Vulnerability Management & Analysis

· Identify, analyze, and prioritize endpoint vulnerabilities using tools such as Tenable, Axonius, Jamf Pro, SCCM, Intune, Active Directory, and Entra.

· Assess environmental and operational factors that may impact remediation feasibility and timelines.

· Provide risk-based recommendations to improve the vulnerability management program.

5.1 Endpoint Remediation, Automation & Documentation

· Develop, test, and deploy remediation scripts and configurations for Windows and macOS endpoints using tools such as Jamf, ConfigMgr/SCCM, Intune, and Group Policy.

· Write clear, maintainable scripts and automation (e.g., modular logic, meaningful naming, basic error handling and logging) that can be reused by the team.

· Document scripts and configurations with purpose, parameters, usage instructions, and any security considerations to support troubleshooting and cross-team adoption.

· Maintain an organized library of remediation artifacts; if applicable, help establish and use a version-controlled repository (e.g., Git) to track changes and support basic peer review.

5.2 Baseline Configuration & Compliance

· Contribute to secure baseline configurations aligned with Argonne CSPP, NIST 800-53 Rev 5, CIS Benchmarks, Microsoft Security Baselines, DISA STIGs, and/or macOS Security Compliance Project.

· Assist in development, testing, implementation, documentation of baseline configurations.

· Monitor baseline implementation for coverage, effectiveness, unapproved deviations, and required changes.

5.3 Collaboration & Reporting

· Participate in regular team meetings to provide status updates, propose improvements, and discuss implementation strategies.

· Monitor endpoint compliance and provide reports on remediation effectiveness and baseline configurations to leadership and stakeholders.

6 Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

The ideal candidate will bring endpoint engineering expertise, strong cyber security skills, and modern, secure coding practices with 3–5 years of experience in complex large enterprise environments.

6.1 Endpoint Management

· Hands-on expertise with SCCM, Jamf Pro, and/or Microsoft Intune for Windows and macOS endpoints.

· Experience packaging and deploying applications, security updates, and scripts across enterprise platforms.

· Familiarity with Group Policy and Intune for configuration management.

6.2 Secure Coding & SDLC Practices

· Proficiency in automation scripting (PowerShell, Bash, Python) with emphasis on modular, reusable, and secure code.

· Strong grasp of SDLC principles: requirements gathering, design, implementation, testing, deployment, and maintenance.

· Experience with version control systems (Git) and collaborative development workflows (branching, pull requests, peer review).

· Ability to document code and remediations clearly for cross-team adoption and knowledge transfer.

6.3 Security Frameworks & Compliance

· Knowledge of CVE program, NIST Vulnerability Database, CISA Known Exploited Vulnerability Database, and overall vulnerability management processes.

· Experience implementing NIST 800-53 Rev 5, CIS Benchmarks, DISA STIGs, Microsoft Security Baselines, and macOS Security Compliance Project.

· Ability to translate technical fixes into measurable improvements in endpoint security posture.

· Experience using Tenable.SC or Tenable.VM as part of vulnerability management.

6.4 Soft Skills

· Strong problem-solving skills with a focus on reducing organizational risk.

· Effective communication skills to convey technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

· Collaborative mindset for working within a mixed Windows/macOS engineering team.

job.title: Industrial Cybersecurity Consultant (34053)
job.description:
Industrial Cybersecurity Consultant
STSI is looking for a Cyber Security Consultant who is detail oriented with a willingness to utilize their investigative mind and dig into remediation issues, conduct security audits, and implement change plans in IT & OT environments. Ideal candidates have experience assessing security and PLC controls with experience conducting security audits, maintaining up to date understanding of guidance from the U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA), and have a firm understanding and experience with Allen Bradley PLC and Modbus PLC universal communication protocol.

Type: Full-time Contract - W2 ONLY, accepting candidate that are a US Citizen (nonnegotiable)
Compensation: $ 50.00 USD to 60.00 USD
# of Positions: 3-5
Location: Richmond, VA and Glen Allen, VA
Travel: 80% - 100% - accepting only local candidates in the state of Virginia who are able to drive/go to different locations/offices in VA. Consultants will use their own vehicle and must have a valid driver's license.
Expense: Miles, Hotel (when required), food are reimbursed expenses.
Schedule: Daylight, Monday through Friday.
Reports to: Director of Network & Endpoint Security, Project Manager & Delivery Lead

Position Summary:
The Cybersecurity Consultant will independently execute significant portions of projects addressing Information Technology (IT) and Industrial Control System security. The Cybersecurity Consultant supports the execution of projects consisting of network penetration testing, web application security testing, cybersecurity vulnerability assessments, secure system design and integration, and/or development of cybersecurity programs at client sites across the U.S and Canada utilizing the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) Cybersecurity Framework (CSF), NIST Risk Management Framework (RMF), and other industry or data specific compliance frameworks and regulations. Execute the planning, design, development and implementation of technical controls, procedures and policy associated with cybersecurity compliance and/or regulatory standards.


Responsibilities:
  • Maintain highest level of integrity, protecting the confidentiality and security of all clients and project information.
  • Identify and diagnose operational issues and implement design alterations to address these issues.
  • Conduct network penetration tests and vulnerability assessments of IT and Operational Technology (OT) networks, for both compliance and security purposes.
  • Perform detailed, post event analysis of unusual events, and direct needed procedure or process changes in response.
  • Pursue, obtain, and maintain industry recognized IT certifications related to cybersecurity such as ethical hacking, network engineering, Industrial Control System (ICS), Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA), risk management, and others as necessary.
  • Resolve technical issues, analyze implications to the client's business, and be able to communicate them with applicable stakeholders within the business.
  • Develop policies & procedures for secure process control network design, technical and design recommendations for the implementation of firewalls and other network security and compliance controls.
  • Compiles technical documentation of network traffic as well as firewall services/solutions including explanations and diagrams.
  • Work collaboratively with other groups and divisions inside the company.
  • Performs other duties as assigned.
  • Comply with all policies and standards.
  • Performs other duties as assigned.

Required Experience:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Cybersecurity, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related technical field and min 3 years of related/relevant experience is Required.
  • Advanced knowledge of security principles and firm knowledge of cybersecurity technologies, as well as industry-recognized certifications.
  • Experience with cybersecurity vulnerability assessments, penetration tests, and the tools/techniques involved in both.
  • Experience in the capabilities and/or configuration of cybersecurity controls, specifically those relating to firewalls, access control, authentication, anti-virus/anti-malware, patching, and logging.
  • Advanced knowledge of control systems utilized by utilities, manufacturing, oil and gas, transportation, smart buildings, and cities.
  • Strong written and oral communication skills.
  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
  • Ability to operate under pressure and under tight deadlines, to operate in on-site industrial, corporate, and government work.
  • Demonstrate capability to make sound decisions based on good security practices and principles.
  • Demonstrate an understanding of business principles and operational security practices specific to engineering and/or security consulting.
  • Knowledge and/or experience with corporate policies and procedures.
  • Strong technical writing skills. Knowledge and experience with modern and legacy computer networking and telecommunications.
  • Experience with physical cabling for network communications and control system Input/Output.
  • Ability to obtain and maintain access to current and future client sites.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected status. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any of these characteristics.

job.title: JD Attorney (33638)
job.description:
Myticas's direct client, based in Minneapolis, MN, is seeking a Legal Analyst/Attorney with J.D. for a hybrid contract position.

Job Title: Legal Analyst/Attorney with J.D.
Work Location: Hybrid, 2 days onsite/week at either of locations - Minneapolis, MN or Glastonbury, CT

Duration: 6+ month contract-to-Hire

 
NOTE: MUST HAVE,
  1. Juris Doctor (J.D.) degree.
  2. Ability to review documents.
  
JOB SUMMARY:
The Legal Invoice Analyst for client, Fulfilment Center of Excellence will be responsible for performing the quality assurance testing for the Legal Bill Analysis Center of Excellence (LBACOE).

job.title: Systems Engineer (33469)
job.description:
As a Systems Engineer, you will help lead the technical direction. You will contribute to the development and integration of sophisticated algorithms, guide performance assessments, and influence architectural decisions that drive the success of the constellation. You will also mentor engineering teams and collaborate across departments to ensure technical alignment with system requirements and seamless integrations.
Main Responsibilities
  • Take ownership of the design, development, and validation of advanced algorithms in MATLAB to optimize system performance and reliability while meeting system requirements.
  • Oversee performance analysis of our clients product, including throughput, latency, satellite handover, availability, capacity, and regulatory compliance metrics.
  • Drive cross-functional collaboration with System Modeling, Software Development, Quality Assurance, and System Engineering teams to ensure seamless integration and testing.
  • Provide technical leadership and mentorship to junior engineers, fostering innovation and continuous improvement.
  • Interface with other teams regarding topics such as satellite payload and ground segment characteristics, definitions of performance metrics, performance evaluations, and regulatory compliance.
  • Lead trade-off studies and system architecture evaluations, contributing to long-term planning and system evolution.
  • Author and review high-quality technical documentation.
  • Follow Agile software development methodologies.
  • Ensure code quality through unit testing, refactoring, and adherence to coding standards.
Education and Experience Required
  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, System Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, or a related field.
  • Experience in related system design and modeling roles, with a minimum of 10 years in similar roles.
  • Strong understanding of software development lifecycle, Agile methodologies, and CI/CD tools.
  • Proven expertise in MATLAB and algorithm development.
  • Experience with Java is an asset.
  • Experience with HPC environments and cluster job managers is an asset.
  • Knowledge of radio communication systems and/or satellite communication is desirable.
  • Experience in mathematical optimization including linear programming is desirable.
Specialized Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
  • Creative problem-solver with thorough attention to detail.
  • Highly collaborative team-player who can quickly earn the confidence of co-workers and teammates.
  • Excellent communication, leadership, and stakeholder engagement skills.
  • Ability to prioritize opportunities, needs and resources
  • An aptitude for and interest in complex technology
  • Fluent in English, written and oral. French is an asse
Salary Range $115,000 - $145,000

job.title: Senior RF Test Engineer (33471)
job.description:
The Senior RF Test Engineer will be responsible for developing and maintaining system verification and validation plans of the communication system. In addition, they will participate in the various testing activities across systems with vendors and other partners and responsible for maintaining the lab.

This position will be moved to our new Gatineau facility in 2026.
Main Responsibilities
  • In this role, the incumbent will issue recommendations and have influence on the system verification and validation.
  • Work with various Antenna Vendors to support the SOW, SRR, Test Requirements, Test Plans, Test Results and RVTM reviews, in addition to follow up on the integrate of the Antenna with the other components (Modem, and other interfaces).
  • Work with the other segments to support the development of the internal Test Plans and verification methods.
  • Support Over The Air (OTA) Test Planning and activities including the Test automation processes.
  • Support System Acceptance Planning activities for the LEOP and IOT.
  • Develop system and sub system verification matrices against system requirements
  • Coordinate and participate in RF and system level testing activities including test planning, execution and reporting
  • Serve as an RF expert and support other technical staff as required
  • Plays an active role in component and subsystem design and test activities
  • Configuring test equipment like Satellite Link Emulators, signal generator, spectrum analyzer etc.
  • Ensure product under test meets technical, functional, performance and business requirements
  • Keep the lab functional and update to date with known hardware and software configuration to execute various test scenarios as necessary
  • Work with partners and other vendors in various test campaigns
Education & Experience Required
  • B. S or M.S.in Electrical, Computer or System Engineering and a minimum of 20 years of relevant experience in satellite communications
  • 10+ years of work experience in different antenna types like Flat Panel Antenna, Parabolic and Aero Antenna (Ka band preferable)
  • 10+ years of work experience in Satellite RF communication systems with strong exposure on modulation and coding used in modern standards like DVB-S2(X) and DVB-RCS2
  • Hands on experience using RF test equipment (Oscilloscopes, Signal Generators, Spectrum Analyzers, satellite channel emulator)
  • Strong understanding of RF engineering Principles and Design Practices
  • Demonstrated understanding of air interfaces, modem technologies, modulation and coding and its impact on the satellite link performance
  • Experience with satellite link budget analyses with good understanding of effects of impairments on the link performance
  • Experience in test case and defect tracking tools (Jira, Jama)
  • Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively with management, engineering teams and partners / suppliers
Preferred Qualifications
  • Experience with different Ka band antenna vendors
  • Experience with Flat Panel Antenna and Aero Antenna (Ka band preferable)
  • Experience with BUC/LNB and various Antenna technologies
  • Experience in Planning activities for the LEOP and IOT.
  • Proficient with MATLAB, python.
  • Highly collaborative team player who can quickly earn the confidence of co-workers and teammates
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills

Salary Range - $95,000 - $135,000

job.title: Senior, FPGA / Hardware Design Engineer (2 Positions) (34282)
job.description:
Senior FPGA / Hardware Design Engineer

We’re looking for a seasoned FPGA / Hardware Design Engineer to help architect and deliver next-generation solutions for high-performance video and data applications. This role involves taking projects from concept through to production, with a strong focus on efficiency, optimization, and real-time system performance.

What You’ll Do

  • Lead FPGA and hardware design efforts, from architecture through testing and validation.

  • Develop, verify, and debug FPGA-based solutions (including UHD-SDI, high-speed transceivers, DDR interfaces, etc.).

  • Support the full product development lifecycle (design, QA, documentation, customer-facing support).

  • Collaborate across teams to ensure high-performance, production-ready solutions.

What You Bring

  • Strong background in RTL design and FPGA development (VHDL/Verilog).

  • Experience with real-time operating systems (RTOS), ideally in video, audio, or image processing.

  • Proven ability in high-volume data processing, compression, and parallel processing for 4K optimization.

  • Hands-on expertise with modern FPGA platforms (Xilinx, Intel/Altera) and related tools.

  • Familiarity with SoC integration, clock domain analysis, and timing closure.

  • Solid understanding of circuit design (power, signal integrity, microprocessor design).

  • Proficiency in debugging with lab tools (oscilloscopes, analyzers, WFMs, etc.).

  • Additional experience with C/C++/Java, scripting, and broadcast workflows is a plus.

job.title: Senior RF Systems Engineer (33470)
job.description:
Senior RF Systems Engineering Specialist – Satellite Communications

This role requires deep technical expertise in satellite RF communications, with a strong focus on physical layer and Layer 2 system design. A solid working knowledge of Layer 3 and higher protocols is also expected. The successful candidate will bring extensive experience with DVB-S2, DVB-S2X, and DVB-RCS2 standards, along with a strong foundation in RF and digital communications theory.

You will have hands-on experience with Adaptive Coding and Modulation (ACM) techniques and a strong understanding of modern antenna technologies, including active and phased array systems. This includes digital beamforming, rapid beam hopping, and antenna performance modelling. The role operates within a systems engineering framework, requiring familiarity with requirements management and the full lifecycle from concept through verification.

Key Responsibilities

  • Analyze and review RF link budgets, conduct system-level trade studies, and model signal impairments to evaluate overall communications performance.

  • Collaborate closely with system architects, RF, antenna, and earth station engineers to allocate functionality between hardware and software while optimizing system performance.

  • Develop and maintain high-level requirements and specifications for RF links, RF subsystems, and antenna systems, including managing requirement updates as designs evolve.

  • Define, review, and assess test plans, procedures, and results to verify compliance with system specifications.

  • Perform system performance characterization and analysis, maintaining detailed performance budgets for assigned system elements.

  • Provide technical expertise in support of regulatory, spectrum coordination, and market access activities.

  • Mentor junior engineers and serve as a technical resource for team members with developing domain expertise.

  • Prepare and deliver technical presentations to internal and external engineering audiences as required.

Education and Experience

  • Master’s degree or higher in Electrical Engineering or a closely related field, with a focus on RF, antenna and microwave engineering, digital communications, or digital signal processing.

  • Minimum of 10 years of relevant experience performing system-level RF or satellite communications engineering.

  • Proven experience with digital communication systems, including spread-spectrum and single- and multi-carrier architectures.

  • Strong background in modulation schemes such as PSK, APSK, and QAM.

  • Direct experience with DVB-S2X, DVB-RCS2, and Adaptive Coding and Modulation techniques.

  • Demonstrated capability in modelling RF communication systems using advanced tools such as MATLAB, Python, or equivalent environments.

Skills and Competencies

  • Strong collaborator who performs effectively in cross-functional engineering teams.

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

  • Ability to clearly explain complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.

  • High standards for technical quality, accuracy, and documentation.

  • Capable of managing multiple complex technical challenges concurrently.

If you want, I can also:

  • Make it more concise

  • Adjust the tone (more corporate, more technical, or more startup-style)

  • Reformat it for LinkedIn, an RFP, or a careers page


    Salary Range - $110,000 - $140,000

Contract: W2– Candidates must be authorized to work in the U.S. on a W2 basis. We cannot accept candidates requiring sponsorship or those from C2C vendors.

Clover Consulting has a direct client in Grand Rapids, MI in need of  a QA Sampler for a 6 months contract with the potential to go 3 years or perm. This is an ON-SITE role.  

Description:
The sampling position would include sampling all raw material and packaging components in several warehouses. The raw material sampling would include materials that are used in the cosmetic and home care products as well as materials that are used in the food industry including allergens. The packaging components would be sampled in the warehouse and this would include inspecting the shipment for defective components.

The materials that are sampled are logged in the QA data system where sampling data is entered. The samples are then delivered to the respective labs including micro, chemistry and packaging. This is NOT a QA laboratory job but may lead to opportunities to gain laboratory experience.

Requirements:
- A valid State of Michigan driver’s license. Candidate will be driving around complex.
- Basic computer skills.
- Science background or science degree is preferred but not required.
- Raw material samplers must wear shoes with full leather uppers.

  • PCF (PowerApps Component Framework)

job.title: Sr Marketing Data Scientist (MMM) (33918)
job.description:
Myticas direct client is seeking Marketing Data Scientist Manager for a 6 months+ contract-to-hire opportunity.

Location: 100% REMOTE
Duration: 6 Months Contract to Hire

Title:

  • Marketing Data Science Manager

About the Role

We are seeking a Marketing Data Science Manager who can bridge the gap between data modeling and business impact. This role will focus on leveraging data science models and analytical frameworks to generate actionable marketing insights, optimize campaign performance, and guide strategic decisions.
The ideal candidate combines strong analytical and technical skills with business acumen and communication ability to translate data into meaningful narratives for stakeholders.

Requirements

  • Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Statistics, Economics, Operation Research, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering, Mathematics, Marketing Analytics etc.
  • Analytical and technical skills:
    • Proficiency (10+ years) in analyzing complex data and models, derive and deliver actionable insights to provide data driven marketing strategy to stakeholders. Strong ability to translate model outputs into business insights and marketing recommendations.
    • Proficiency (7+ years) in statistical software such as SQL, R, Python, PBI for data wrangling and modeling.
    • Familiarity (5+ years) with AWS Sagemaker and Lambda functions. Terraform experience will be preferred.
    • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Experience (required):
    • At least 10 years hands on experience in machine learning, marketing analytics, statistical modeling, marketing mix modeling.
    • At least 10 years experience with various statistical techniques such as regression analysis, time series analysis, and predictive modeling, optimization etc.
    • Familiarity (5+ years) with marketing research methodologies and tools.
  • Experience (good to have):
    • AI and multi-touch attribution model experience
    • Familiarity with ad platforms (Google Ads, DV360, etc.)
    • Experience in A/B testing or experimentation frameworks
  • Marketing Knowledge:
    • Deep understanding of marketing concepts, including advertising, distribution, and campaign strategies.
    • Familiarity with different marketing channels and their impact on business performance.
    • Knowledge of industry trends and best practices in marketing analytics.
  • Business Acumen:
    • Understanding of business objectives and how marketing analytics can support decision-making and drive business growth.
    • Ability to align marketing strategies with broader organizational goals and objectives.
  • Communication Skills:
    • Ability to communicate complex analytical findings to non-technical stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
    • Collaborative approach to working with cross-functional teams, including media, creative, product, and finance.

Skills

  • Proficient in machine learning model and statistical model development, simulation and optimization and deployment in AWS
  • Proficient in SQL, Python, R for data integration and modeling projects
  • Advanced in AWS Sagemaker, EC2, S3, Terraform, Bitbucket, etc for deployment projects
  • Advanced in PBI, Excel, streamlit for analytics and visualization projects
  • Experience in Terraform, EC2, MMM, optimizer application will be a big plus

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and deploy predictive and statistical models to evaluate marketing performance (e.g., attribution, media mix modeling, churn, LTV, segmentation, optimization).
  • Partner with marketing, product team to translate modeling results into clear business insights & recommendations that drive growth and ROI and communicate implications to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Present findings to senior stakeholders through clear storytelling and visualization.
  • Visualize and present analytical results using tools like Power BI, Excel, etc.
  • Build and maintain scalable analytics pipelines using Python/R, SQL, and possibly cloud data platforms (GCP, AWS, Azure).
  • Partner with marketing operations to operationalize insights (e.g., audience targeting, spend optimization).
  • Collaborate with data engineers and analysts to improve data accessibility and accuracy.
  • Support ongoing model performance monitoring and iterative improvements.
  • Support MMM and app maintenance and development for simulation and optimization and further development. Push changes to production using AWS Sagemaker, EC2, Terraform, Bitbucket, etc.
  • Assist with ad-hoc data requests, data exploration and building business knowledge models. Build intelligent dashboards if needed using SQL, PBI. 
  • Conduct cross-functional collaboration, stakeholder meetings and provide documentations and internal trainings.
  • Lead projects, manage timelines, and ensure deliverables meet the business objectives and are delivered on time.
  • Perform other duties as assigned or apparent.
  • Work with marketing and product teams to design experiments, measure campaign ROI, and inform strategy.

What You’ll Gain

  • Opportunity to help shape the organization’s marketing data science and insights function.
  • Direct influence on marketing strategy and customer growth initiatives.
  • Exposure to cutting-edge analytics and experimentation techniques in a data-driven culture.
  • Path to full-time employment with strong career growth opportunities.

job.title: MuleSoft Developer (34498)

job.title: Embedded Software Developer (32938)
job.description:
In this role, Senior Embedded Software Developer will assume ownership of specific software modules, overseeing their development, quality, and functionality. 
As an integral part of our scrum team, this role will contribute to the design, development/coding and testing of our cutting edge Software by actively engaging with both the test and support teams to ensure comprehensive testing and efficient bug resolution. In addition, you will take the lead in technical discussions and guide decision-making processes and lead and document technical discussions.

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:
    • Collaborate with experienced engineers in the design, coding, testing, and maintenance of software applications.
    • Develop and maintain embedded software modules using programming languages like C++ and Python.
    • Assist in the implementation of networking solutions, ensuring seamless communication between software components.
    • Contribute to the development of software tools, libraries, and frameworks to enhance overall product quality and efficiency.
    • Participate in code reviews, providing constructive feedback to enhance code quality and adherence to coding standards.
    • Collaborate with the team to troubleshoot and resolve software defects and technical issues.
    • Support the integration of software components on Linux operating systems.
    • Assist in the testing and validation of software features, ensuring functionality and performance meet specified requirements.
    • Utilize cloud technologies to enhance software deployment and management.
    • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product managers and designers, to understand requirements and contribute to technical discussions.
    • Maintain clear and organized documentation of software designs, processes, and development tasks.
    • Demonstrate effective teamwork and communication skills, both orally and in writing. Lead the design, development, and implementation of advanced satellite ground segment software systems, ensuring high performance, scalability, and reliability.

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:
    • Bachelor's in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
    • 8+ year software development experience in embedded system (Linux, ARM cores) with experience in software and firmware upgrades and device commissioning (YANG).
    • 8+ year experience in developing and troubleshooting low level application services which interface to devices through hardware interface.
    • 8+ year experience in developing software using modern C/ C++.
    • Good understanding of L1/L2 networking protocols (IPSEC, MACsec, secure tunnel), NETCONF.
    • Experience with platform module for platform security.
    • SW development in the satellite communication systems is a plus.
    • Working experience with Agile scrum methodology.

job.title: SAP FI/SD RAR Senior Consultant (34482)
job.description:

  • Design custom solutions (user exits/BAdIs, BRF+, enhancements) to support deferred revenue recognition until transfer of ownership.

  • Strong understanding of SD–FI integration: billing, pricing, account determination, event-based revenue recognition.

  • Support SAP-enabled revenue accounting processes, functional specs, unit testing, and client support for training/testing.

Required Experience

  • 7+ years hands-on SAP experience with large-scale S/4HANA deployments in RAR

  • Strong knowledge of event-based revenue recognition, SD–FI integration, and IFRS 15 compliance

  • Experience creating functional specs and supporting test cycles

Nice to Have

  • Mining industry experience

  • Practical IFRS 15 application in S/4HANA

  • Experience with milestone/time-based/transfer-of-control revenue variants

  • Exposure to revenue contract data migration

  • Familiarity with pricing/valuation scenarios (provisional pricing, revaluation)

  • CPA designation

job.title: Quality Assurance Lead (34091)
job.description:
Clover Consulting has a direct client in Grand Rapids, MI in need of a Software QA with Leadership experience for and ON-SITE role.  This is for a 6-12 months contract with the potential for hire.  Client cannot sponsor.  

Given the scale and complexity of the program, it is critical for candidates to demonstrate leadership, cross team coordination, communication, and the ability to command a room in order to be successful in this role. Those moving forward should be able to showcase these skills with concrete examples from their own experience.

What you will be doing:  
  • Take ownership to ensure the test deliverables are met to standards, quality practices and end-user requirements for IT projects and programs
  • Coordinate within and across teams to create test strategy, test plans, timelines and alignment on test execution
  • Coordinate within and across teams to build test scenarios, test cases, test data and other quality-related deliverables
  • ?Develop comprehensive test strategies with input from developers, analysts, enabling teams and process experts
  • Facilitate the development of test plans, test scenarios and test cases for Product Teams
  • Ensure test data and other needed information is prepared and available for test execution
  • Align with Program test deliverables and take ownership in preparing and coordinating testing for your assigned teams
  • Ensure test deliverables are met on time to meet program requirements
  • Take responsibility to facilitate and coordinate test execution within and across project teams
  • Take ownership to coordinate cross team test execution and make sure test progress is made on day to day basis
  • Coordinate and facilitate the bug life cycle to remove blockers promptly during test coordination
  • Ensure bugs are logged and assigned to the respective owner to fix
  • Make sure bugs get retested to ensure the fix is applied and the feature works as expected
  • Create test reports and dashboard to provide quality metrics and analysis on testing
  • Collaborate closely with other team members to continuously improve and adjust standards and practices.
  • Partner with Automation Specialists to deliver automated testing strategies by providing manual test scripts, test data and other relevant information for automation
 
Key Skillset to have:
 
  • Project Management experience
  • Leadership
  • Strong QA expertise
  • Problem solving
  • Cross team coordination
  • Strong communication
  • Self - driven and self-motivated
  • Committed to deliver results on time
·Ability to quickly jump into projects to understand the business processes and lead testing
 
Must haves:
·Minimum 3-5 years in leading software projects in Testing area
·Expertise in Software testing and best practices
·Strong project management skillset
·Strong leadership skills
·Strong communication – written and verbal
·Reporting and metrics
 
Nice to have:
·ADO experience
·SAP experience is a plus
 
Technical Components of the position includes such tools and technologies as MS Azure DevOps, MS Visual Studio, Service Now, SAP, Web Technologies, Microsoft Office suite, etc.
 
Who you are:  
We are looking for someone who is self-directed and highly motivated to deliver results. You should be driven, energetic, flexible, and able to coordinate people and processes globally. You will enjoy working with us if you enjoy interacting with many different people, leading software projects, learning many different business processes and technologies, and exploring new tools and new ways of working.  You should have both strong software quality knowledge & leadership skills to join our team.
 
Qualifications: 
 
·Bachelor’s degree
·Minimum 3-5 years in leading software projects in Testing area
·Expertise in leading testing projects and has experience in Testing methodology, practices, processes and tools
·Expertise in coordinating testing for global programs/projects
·Strong leadership/interpersonal skills and project management skillset
·Ambitious team player, who is collaborative with all audiences
·Ability to quickly jump into projects to understand the business processes and lead testing
·Ability to embrace details and understand the ‘big picture’ and contribute to the successful delivery of milestones
·Experience working in Agile/SCRUM software development environment and strong knowledge of SCRUM practices
·Understanding of programming and development languages such as Java, C, .NET
·Experience in testing web, SAP application

job.title: Data Analyst / Developer (Power BI & Microsoft Fabric) (34507)

Required Qualifications

  • 2+ years hands-on experience in Microsoft Fabric (Workspaces, Notebooks, Pipelines, OneLake, SQL Analytics).

  • Experience as a technical lead in a Power BI or Fabric Community of Practice.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

job.title: Lead Architect – Microsoft Fabric / Data Platform Migration (34511)
job.description:
Our client is seeking a Lead Architect to support the final phase of an on-prem Oracle OBIEE migration to Microsoft Fabric and assist in closing out the remaining architecture backlog. This REMOTE engagement includes Fabric architecture, ETL validation, CI/CD optimization, and supporting dashboard development and cutover readiness.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead architectural delivery for the OBIEE → Microsoft Fabric migration.

  • Design and enhance Microsoft Fabric solutions including Lakehouse, Data Engineering, Pipelines, and OneLake security.

  • Finalize backlog items related to end-to-end data architecture, ingestion, transformation, storage, governance, and consumption.

  • Provide technical leadership across ETL load patterns (full, incremental, CDC) and data pipeline performance validation.

  • Create incremental testing plans and validate end-to-end data accuracy after migration.

  • Own and optimize CI/CD pipelines (Git, Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions) for Fabric and data engineering solutions.

  • Document architecture, solution designs, technical wikis, and maintain clear, maintainable code.

  • Lead cutover planning, go-live support, and early hypercare activities.

  • Guide engineers and architects on ETL optimization, deployment timelines, and data validation.

  • Engage directly with stakeholders, lead workshops, and communicate complex architecture decisions in business-friendly terms.

Required Skills & Qualifications

Microsoft Fabric Expertise

  • Hands-on experience with Fabric Lakehouse, Data Engineering, Pipelines, and OneLake security models.

  • Strong understanding of Fabric capacities, workspaces, lakehouse schema design, delta/parquet, and security boundaries.

Azure & Data Platform Architecture

  • Experience designing/documenting end-to-end Azure data architectures (ingestion → transformation → storage → governance → consumption).

ETL / Data Engineering

  • Strong knowledge of full loads, incremental loads, CDC patterns, and ETL performance testing.

  • Experience validating data quality and accuracy post-migration.

DevOps / CI/CD

  • Experience with Git, Azure DevOps, or GitHub Actions.

  • Ability to optimize CI/CD, document processes, and automate Fabric deployments.

  • Understanding of branching strategies, code quality, and environment promotion.

Documentation & Governance

  • Able to produce architecture documents, solution designs, Wikis, and maintain clean/readable code.

Technical Leadership

  • Experience leading cutover plans, go-live readiness, hypercare, and cross-team technical troubleshooting.

  • Ability to coach engineers and guide architectural decisions.

Client Engagement & Communication

  • Strong stakeholder management and communication skills.

  • Comfortable leading client sessions, technical walkthroughs, and migration readiness discussions.

job.title: ServiceNow Technical Consultant / Developer (CSM Migration) (34512)

job.title: Azure Integration Developer (34517)

job.title: Automation Engineer (34485)
job.description:
Automation Engineer
Location: Houston, TX
Pay Range: $70.00 - $100.00 per hour
Benefits: Standard Medical, Dental, 401(k)

Purpose:

The primary purpose of this role is to drive execution of automation engineering projects within the Autonomous and Automation Americas team by leveraging cutting-edge digital, technology, and autonomous solutions across multiple vendor platforms. The consultant will play a pivotal role in delivering innovative solutions that enhance operational efficiency, safety, and sustainability in mining, on-shore or off-shore operations.

This is a full-time hybrid position based in Houston, Texas, Denver, Colorado, or Calgary, Alberta, Canada.


Overall Responsibilities and Key Accountabilities
  • Strong self-starter, entrepreneurial mindset and motivated.
  • Work with client to share work and integrate staff on projects for a blended execution team.
  • Project experience including coordinating interfaces with engineering partners, construction contractors, equipment manufacturers, system integrators and project management as well as technical disciplines including process, civil, structural, piping, mechanical, and electrical.
  • Desire to expand role and be adaptable to client's needs.
  • Assists, and later, leads the preparation of proposals, execution plans and budgets.
  • Project experience working on all engineering phases within a project from concept through design and engineering, construction support, and commissioning/validation and handover.
  • Programming and configuring PLC and DCS platforms while leading a team for project implementation. Hands on and leading.
  • Team will be responsible for producing process automation deliverables - control narratives, cause and effect drawings, Boolean logic diagrams, DCS / SIS / PLC functional specifications, produce system cabinet layout drawings, wiring diagrams, system card layout and loading.  Also, basic I&C deliverables such as instrument datasheets, instrument index, wiring diagrams, system architecture will be in scope.
  • Project experience in the development and commissioning of complex automation projects.
  • Excellent communication skills including ability to communicate complex ideas effectively, produce concise reports and presentations appropriate for all levels.
  • Takes ownership for project success: delivery of target quality, cost management and customer satisfaction.
  • Proactively builds a knowledge base of tools and methodologies to drive productivity and growth.
  • Lead role in work process improvement.
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a multicultural environment.
  • Travel as required for various field programs – can be 25-50% depending on project phase and assignment.

job.title: Piping Designer / Area Lead (34490)
job.description:
Piping Design Lead – Cadworx, Revit
Hybrid out of the following locations: Portland, OR / Phoenix, AZ / Pittsburgh, PA / Boise, ID
Rate: $52 - 68/hour
Responsibilities:
  • Provide direction and coordinate the work of sub-leads and piping designers to ensure project execution with high design quality.
  • Manage delivery schedule including escalation to project managers when schedule is at jeopardy.
  • Support piping design team and facilitate resolution of design challenges. Develop resource loaders to predict budget burn rate and overall estimate to complete work.
  • Coordinate design with other disciplines (Electrical, Mechanical, Structural, etc.) to ensure success of project.
  • Position may also require field support activities on client site including site walks.
  • Will be working with an engineering design team on high-tech industrial manufacturing facility projects.
  • This is a hybrid position, with the candidate being hired in one of the following locations for a 2 day/week in-office schedule: Portland, OR / Phoenix, AZ / Pittsburgh, PA / Boise, ID.

  • Motivated, self-starting Piping Area Lead with 5+ years leading small teams (or larger) as a senior designer responsible for an area of scope.
  • Candidate will have experience understanding and clarifying scope, working with cross-discipline teams, and ensuring their scope and team can meet the delivery schedule.
  • Work with Process and Mechanical engineers to resolve design challenges for the piping team.

  • Must be well organized with strong communication skills. Ideal candidate will have have recent experience and be a knowledgeable user of CADWorx 3D and or Revit design software and Navisworks.
  • Experience with process mechanical piping systems, industrial waste and high purity water systems a plus.
  • Microelectronics (Semiconductor) experience a plus.
  • Experience with pipe installation details and pipe supports, a plus.
  • High school diploma or equivalent preferred instead of required.

job.title: Electrical Engineer (34494)
job.description:
Electrical Engineering Professional Career Level 
Wilton, CT (On-site)

Benefits: Standard Medical, Dental, 401(k)
Pay Range: $60.10 /hr. - $84.13 /hr.

Responsibilities:
 
  • Responsible for interacting with the client, contractors, and site personnel.
  • Designing, developing, evaluating, and preparing recommendations with basis of design (BOD), scope of work (SOW) documents, in addition to design, construction and specifications documents through the positional (programming) process with a team.
  • Oversee engineering and construction for the facility power distributions system work (up to 13.8kV), grounding, lighting, emergency and standby generation systems, life safety systems, and fire alarm and detection systems. The work will include retrofit of existing building systems as well as new systems.
Experience:

job.title: Environmental Wastewater Treatment System Technician (33502)
job.description:
Environmental Wastewater Treatment System Technician
Magnolia, Arkansas (On-site)

Benefits: Standard Medical, Dental, 401(k)
Pay Range: $32.07 /hr. - $51.29 /hr.

Summary: Seeking a full-time Environmental Wastewater Treatment System Technician responsible for operation and maintenance (O&M) of remediation systems at a former industrial site. The successful candidate shall perform office and field tasks necessary to operate and maintain groundwater collection and treatment systems. Field tasks include inspections, sample collection, preventative maintenance and repair, grounds keeping (e.g., mowing, weed eating, herbicide application, and painting), and subcontractor oversight. Office tasks include monitoring operational data and reporting.

Responsibilities:
  • Performs a variety of tasks in the operation and maintenance of water collection and treatment systems including maintenance of equipment, quality control/testing and day-to-day activities on an assigned shift.
  • Operates collection and treatment facilities to control flow and processing of water.
  • Monitors gauges, meters, and control panels.
  • Observes variations in operating conditions and interprets meter and gauge readings.
  • Operates valves either manually or by remote control.
  • Starts and stops pump, motors, and generators to control and adjust the flow of treatment processes.
  • Conducts and documents the results of inspections activities.
  • Performs routine maintenance functions, groundskeeping, and custodial duties.
  • Performs and oversees field tasks with minimal supervision and makes operating decisions in absence of supervisory personnel.
  • Understands and carries out oral and written directions.
  • Conducts routine setup, assembly, installation, and minor troubleshooting or repair of remediation equipment.
  • Acts as onsite lead for maintaining compliance with permit conditions.
  • Completes clear and detailed field documentation, including daily and weekly reports, photographic logs, inspection sheets, and preventative maintenance records.
  • Performs waste management activities including inspection of waste accumulation areas, tracking waste inventories, and overseeing waste pickups.
Qualifications:
  • Basic familiarity with operating principles of valves, pumps, and motors; water/wastewater treatment processes; and associated safe work practices.
  • High school diploma or GED.
  • 40-hour OSHA HAZWOPER certification or ability to obtain this training.
  • Valid driver’s license.
  • Ability and willingness to work as a team with one other full-time technician to facilitate uninterrupted operation of remediation systems by working alternating 8-day shifts, 10 hours per day, 365 days per year. Alternatively, 4-day work shifts (Friday – Monday) may be considered.
  • Willingness to remotely monitor remediation system operating conditions and to receive and periodically respond to after-hours automated system alarms during designated work shifts.
  • Reside within 30 minutes of Magnolia, Arkansas or have a willingness to relocate.
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Outlook), data management systems and ability to operate Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC) and Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) systems.
  • Demonstrated mechanical aptitude and ability to apply basic mechanical principles.
  • Ability to lift 30 pounds and perform physical tasks (bending, kneeling, and walking on uneven terrain).
  • Ability to operate light landscaping equipment (weed whacker, zero turn lawn mower, push mower, backpack sprayer, shovel, and rake), a utility task vehicle (UTV), and all-terrain telehandler forklift.
  • Strong communication skills and ability to work effectively within a team.


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected status. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any of these characteristics.

job.title: Part-Time AR Specialist (33322)
job.description:
Job Title: Part-Time Accounts Receivable (AR) Specialist

Location: Wood Dale, IL (on-site initially; hybrid option available after approximately 2 months)
Duration: 3 months with potential for extension
Schedule: Part-time (approximately 20–22 hours per week)
Pay Rate: Competitive hourly rate, commensurate with experience

Job Summary

The Temporary Accounts Receivable (AR) Specialist will support day-to-day accounting operations with a primary focus on invoicing, cash application, and collections. This role plays a key part in ensuring accurate and timely processing of customer payments, maintaining current receivables records, and assisting with month-end close and reporting. The position is designed to support increased workload and will work closely with both finance and sales teams.

Key Responsibilities

  • Generate and distribute customer invoices accurately and on time through the company’s ERP system

  • Record and apply incoming payments (checks, ACH, credit cards) to customer accounts

  • Monitor accounts receivable aging and follow up on outstanding balances

  • Communicate with customers to resolve billing discrepancies, payment delays, or credit issues

  • Process credit memos, adjustments, and account reconciliations

  • Assist with month-end and year-end close activities, including AR-related journal entries

  • Prepare and maintain AR reports for management review

  • Ensure compliance with company policies and maintain proper documentation

  • Provide general accounting and administrative support as needed

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or equivalent experience preferred

  • Minimum of 2 years of accounts receivable or general accounting experience

  • Experience in a manufacturing or similar environment preferred

  • Intermediate to advanced Excel skills; ERP system experience strongly preferred

  • Strong attention to detail, accuracy, and organizational skills

  • Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills with a customer-service mindset

  • High level of professionalism, integrity, and ability to work collaboratively

job.description:
Construction Project Manager, Renewable Projects

Schaumburg, IL (On-site)
Benefits: Access to Client Full Benefits Package 
Pay Range: $145-160K 

Summary:

The Construction Project Manager will lead planning, coordination, and execution of utility-scale renewable (solar, wind, battery storage) and thermal (natural gas or combined cycle) power projects.  The role oversees pre-construction development and planning, EPC contract management, reporting, safety compliance, schedule performance, and budget adherence to ensure successful project delivery from pre-construction through commissioning.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage construction activities for renewable and thermal generation projects, ensuring scope, schedule, cost, and quality targets are met.
  • Coordinate with development, engineering, procurement, and finance teams to transition projects from development to construction.
  • Oversee EPC and subcontractor performance, ensuring compliance with contractual, technical, and safety requirements.
  • Lead site mobilization, logistics, and construction sequencing in alignment with project milestones.
  • Develop and track detailed project schedules using Primavera P6 or MS Project.
  • Manage RFIs, change orders, and progress payments in collaboration with the project controls team.
  • Lead regular progress meetings, issue tracking, and reporting to senior management and project stakeholders.
  • Support grid interconnection activities and testing/commissioning in coordination with utilities and ISO representatives.
  • Facilitate turnover to operations and maintenance teams upon project completion.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Construction Management, Civil/Mechanical/Electrical Engineering, or related field.
  • 6+ years managing utility-scale energy construction projects, including both renewable and thermal generation.
  • Strong knowledge of EPC contract management and project delivery methods
  • Proficiency in project scheduling and cost control software (Primavera P6, MS Project, Excel).
  • Demonstrated understanding of grid interconnection, commissioning, and QA/QC processes.
  • Experience with environmental and permitting compliance during construction phases.
  • Excellent leadership, problem solving, communication, and organizational skills.
  • Experience with both fossil and renewable generation plant construction would be a plus
  • Familiarity with ERCOT or ISO project interconnection and testing requirements preferred
  • Professional Engineer (PE) license or PMP certification would be a plus, but not required
  • Experience in contract negotiation and claims management.
  • Ability to manage multiple projects and site teams concurrently.
